title: Think AI will replace you? The real risk is not using it. Mamaearth's Ghazal Alagh explains how
description: Mamaearth co-founder Ghazal Alagh has cautioned that artificial intelligence is not a direct threat to jobs or businesses, but ignoring its potential could prove costly. In a LinkedIn post, she pointed out that industries historically failed not because of new technology but because of their resistance to change. Alagh highlighted how Honasa Consumer Ltd. is using AI for personalized product recommendations, ad generation, inventory forecasting, and customer service.
content:

title: How The Wedding Fellas Are Redefining Wedding Photography with AI in 2025
description: Wedding photography is evolving rapidly in 2025, thanks to artificial intelligence (AI), and Karan, founder of The Wedding Fellas is leading the change. title: Artificial intelligence helps break barriers for Hispanic homeownership
description: Some mortgage experts are using AI tools to help limited-English homebuyers navigate the loan application process.
content:
For many Hispanics the road to homeownership is filled with obstacles, including loan officers who don’t speak Spanish or aren’t familiar with buyers who may not fit the boxes of a traditional mortgage applicant.

title: AI chip designed by IIT innovator unveiled at T
description: India's indigenously designed Artificial Intelligence (AI) chips, developed with homegrown technology and talent, have been unveiled by innovators at the T-CHIP Semicon Constitution Summit in Hyderabad. These chips, built entirely in Telangana, mark a step in creating a self-reliant semiconductor ecosystem in the country.
